# core.parameters.VectorParameter { #optyx.core.parameters.VectorParameter }

```python
core.parameters.VectorParameter(name, size, values=None)
```

A vector of parameters for array-valued constants.

VectorParameter creates a collection of scalar Parameter instances
that can be updated together, useful for time-varying vectors like
demand forecasts or price curves.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type                                                              | Description                                                   | Default    |
|--------|-------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| name   | [str](`str`)                                                      | Base name for the parameters. Elements are named "{name}[i]". | _required_ |
| size   | [int](`int`)                                                      | Number of elements.                                           | _required_ |
| values | [ArrayLike](`numpy.typing.ArrayLike`) \| [float](`float`) \| None | Initial values (array-like or scalar for all elements).       | `None`     |

## Example {.doc-section .doc-section-example}

>>> from optyx import VectorVariable, VectorParameter, dot
>>>
>>> # Time-varying prices
>>> prices = VectorParameter("price", 24, values=[100]*24)
>>> quantities = VectorVariable("q", 24, lb=0)
>>>
>>> revenue = dot(prices, quantities)
>>>
>>> # Update prices for next solve
>>> prices.set([105, 110, 115, ...])  # New price forecast

### get_values { #optyx.core.parameters.VectorParameter.get_values }

### set { #optyx.core.parameters.VectorParameter.set }

```python

```

Update all parameter values.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type                                  | Description                             | Default    |
|--------|---------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------|------------|
| values | [ArrayLike](`numpy.typing.ArrayLike`) | New values (array-like of length size). | _required_ |

#### Raises {.doc-section .doc-section-raises}

| Name   | Type                       | Description                          |
|--------|----------------------------|--------------------------------------|
|        | [ValueError](`ValueError`) | If values length doesn't match size. |

### to_numpy { #optyx.core.parameters.VectorParameter.to_numpy }

```python
core.parameters.VectorParameter.to_numpy()
```

Get all current parameter values as numpy array.

This is an alias for get_values() for consistency with
VectorVariable.to_numpy().
